author: mrmitch
title: Inexpensive set and another Space man for Mars
review: No frills set, small simple, good looking mini figure. The wheels are different than any model I have. Have a few sets of Life On Mars and this was a cheap one to add to the bunch. O K set I do have two of these in my collection as one was given to me as a gag gift by a old High School buddy.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Explore, Explore, Explore
review:
Set #7301 Rover: This little set might be considered an embarrassment by some, but it is still a cheap way to get a Mini-Figure. Well it was at retail, I'm not sure of how in-demand this little thing is nowadays, but I can't imagine much since it was an impulse set and tended to litter store shelves for several months.

 

The Rover is the only little set amongst the four that includes a LEGO astronaut rather than a Martian and I feel that may be where this set suffers. The model is much too simplistic and lacks proper looking wheels. This little set should have been included with a much larger vessel, then it would have been better as the small one-man land unit that is used to dig up samples from Mars.

 

If you want this set and have a chance to get it go for it, but if you're only passingly interested in it I'd say try to get it with the other three sets 7300 - 7303 because on its own this set just isn't worth much. I kind of like it though still a little bit, maybe because he's the underdog of the group. Daring to be different.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Space (Life On Mars) - Rover
review:
The Rover (7301) is a LEGO Space (Life On Mars) set which came out in 2001. It comes with 1 minifig and 28 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7301-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Assistant: The assistant comes with a gray helmet with a transparent blue visor, blue arms, blue pants and a black belt. On his torso you can see an armor and on his face you can see blue glasses and a headset.

Rover:

The rover is a very simple model to build but it's still very nice. On the front you can find a steering wheel and on the back you can see an antenna and two handles. One handle is holding a radar. The most interesting part are the wheels: The wheels are made out of white domes.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifigs
Very sturdy
Nice starter set
No stickers

Negative:

Not so many play features


All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/
